titleStmt.title: Reuben Hitchcock to James F. Robinson
CWG1301

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1862-1863

body.p:
Office Special Commissioner,
CAMP CHASE,
Columbus, Ohio, Oct 10 1862
To His Excellency
James Robinson
Gov of Kentucky
Dear Sir

On the 5th of May last, there was sent here from the Head Quarters of the Provost Guard at Louisville, by Henry Dent Lt Col & Pro. Marshall two men arrested at Somerset Ky March 12, against whom no charges or evidence is on file -- They were sent as State prisoners -- Will you have the goodness to cause information to be given me immediately of the charges & evidence against them, if any? I address you because I know not where else to address at Louisville --

Very truly yours &c
Reuben Hitchcock
Spl Commissioner
